learning_outcomes.description: Analyse and describe research designs in the Psychological literature, and to produce appropriate designs for new research.
Write and orally present critical evaluations of empirical research in Psychology, especially in terms of threats to causal inferences about observed relationships among constructs.
Understand and apply methodological techniques to enhance the sensitivity, validity and interpretability of empirical research studies.
Understand the shared aims of researchers in different areas of psychology.
To apply what you have learned about evaluating evidence to decisions in your own life.

assessments.task_description:
Tutorials are an important part of the course that will help you apply the concepts introduced in the lectures, and hone your skills of evaluating research. Therefore, it is important that you attend all tutorials.

Knowledge of the lecture contents is essential for the tutorials.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Quiz with short answer questions on case studies
assessments.due_date:
17/09/2024

The quiz will take place during the lecture time in the specified week
assessments.task_description:
This in-class test will assess your understanding of the contents of the lectures and tutorials. The test consists mainly of short-answer questions regarding the design, results and conclusions of case studies or examples (no prior reading required). This test will be open book, which means that you can use all course materials during the assignment. No other aids are permitted (only the course materials), and each student needs to complete the test entirely individually, on their own.  

Prior to the in-class test, everyone will be offered an opportunity to complete a practice test and receive feedback on it, which optimally prepares everyone for this test.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Turnitin via blackboard. NOTE: Please check that your test has been received and download a copy of the digital receipt and keep this as a record.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Assignment - short answer questions on a research paper
assessments.due_date:
14/10/2024 - 18/10/2024

The questions and paper will be provided to students on Monday the 14th October with a due date of 2pm Friday 18th October
assessments.task_description:
This take-home assignment will assess your understanding of the contents of the lectures and tutorials. The test consists mainly of short-answer questions regarding the design, results and conclusions of a paper that you need to read prior to the assignment. This assignment will be open-book, which means that you can use all course materials during the assignment. No other aids are permitted (only the course materials), and each student needs to complete the test entirely individually, on their own.  

Prior to the assignment, everyone will be offered an opportunity to complete a practice test and receive feedback on it, which optimally prepares everyone for this assignment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Turnitin via blackboard. NOTE: Please check that your test has been received and download a copy of the digital receipt and keep this as a record.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction: Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables

I) Introduction: Overview of the Course and how to do well in PSYC3042.

II) The Scientific Method: Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction: Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables I) Introduction : Overview of the Course and how to do well in PSYC3042. II) The Scientific Method: Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables

learning_activities.topic:
Exercises on Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables

Constructs, Variables and Operationalisations. Complete exercises on independent and dependent constructs and relations / operationalisations.

Exercises can be completed on your own electronic device, a PC supplied in the computer room (if your tutorial is held in a computer room), or you can print out the Student's Handbook section for this week and complete it with a pen.

Readings: Read Petty et al. for next Lecture + Tutorials
learning_activities.topic_description: Exercises on Constructs, Operationalisations and Variables Constructs, Variables and Operationalisations . Complete exercises on independent and dependent constructs and relations / operationalisations. Exercises can be completed on your own electronic device, a PC supplied in the computer room (if your tutorial is held in a computer room), or you can print out the Student's Handbook section for this week and complete it with a pen. Readings: Read Petty et al. for next Lecture + Tutorials

learning_activities.topic:
Three Types of Validity

Three types of validity: construct validity, internal validity & external validity

Includes: Spurious Results, Reverse Causation, Simpson’s Paradox (as threats to internal validity).
learning_activities.topic_description: Three Types of Validity Three types of validity: construct validity, internal validity & external validity Includes: Spurious Results, Reverse Causation, Simpson’s Paradox (as threats to internal validity).

learning_activities.topic:
Exercises on Validity, Reliability and Replicability

Complete exercises on identifying IVs, DVs; examine the operationalisations and variables in a published paper (Petty et al.).
learning_activities.topic_description: Exercises on Validity, Reliability and Replicability Complete exercises on identifying IVs, DVs; examine the operationalisations and variables in a published paper (Petty et al.).

learning_activities.topic:
Basic Designs (within, between, mixed & pre-post)

Different types of validity, relationships, mediation and moderation.
learning_activities.topic_description: Basic Designs (within, between, mixed & pre-post) Different types of validity, relationships, mediation and moderation.

learning_activities.topic:
Exercises on Research Designs

Research Designs: Identify the variables and design features of hypothetical studies.

Readings: Read Amato for next Lecture and Tutorials
learning_activities.topic_description: Exercises on Research Designs Research Designs : Identify the variables and design features of hypothetical studies. Readings: Read Amato for next Lecture and Tutorials

learning_activities.topic:
Interactions

Ordinal vs. disordinal interactions and (complex) main effects.

Includes also: Floor and Ceiling Effects, Regression to the Mean
learning_activities.topic_description: Interactions Ordinal vs. disordinal interactions and (complex) main effects. Includes also: Floor and Ceiling Effects, Regression to the Mean

learning_activities.topic:
Exercises on Predictions and Interactions

Derive predictions in case studies; identify designs in case studies and published papers; classify and plot interactions.
learning_activities.topic_description: Exercises on Predictions and Interactions Derive predictions in case studies; identify designs in case studies and published papers; classify and plot interactions.

learning_activities.topic:
Confounds, Counter-Confounds and Sensitivity

Confounds, Counter-Confounds and Sensitivity: Definitions, Floor and Ceiling Effects and Regression to the Mean as Confounds; Prevention and Remedies
learning_activities.topic_description: Confounds, Counter-Confounds and Sensitivity Confounds, Counter-Confounds and Sensitivity : Definitions, Floor and Ceiling Effects and Regression to the Mean as Confounds; Prevention and Remedies

learning_activities.topic:
Exercises on Design-Related Confounds

Analyse hypothetical research designs; consider possible confounds and other problems and their effects on interpretation.
learning_activities.topic_description: Exercises on Design-Related Confounds Analyse hypothetical research designs; consider possible confounds and other problems and their effects on interpretation.

learning_activities.topic:
More Confounds, Preventions and Remedies

Design-Related Confounds, Prevention and Remedies: Discussion of Person Variable Confounds, Ceiling/Floor Effects and Regression to the Mean. Design-related confounds (PAV IVs, Differential Attrition, History and Maturation Confounds.
learning_activities.topic_description: More Confounds, Preventions and Remedies Design-Related Confounds, Prevention and Remedies: Discussion of Person Variable Confounds, Ceiling/Floor Effects and Regression to the Mean. Design-related confounds (PAV IVs, Differential Attrition, History and Maturation Confounds.

learning_activities.topic:
Disucssion of answers to the Practice Test No 1

In-class practice test No. 1 and discussion of answers. (Not marked.)

Readings: Re-read Petty et al. & Amato papers for next tutorial
learning_activities.topic_title: Disucssion of answers to the Practice Test No 1
learning_activities.topic_description: Disucssion of answers to the Practice Test No 1 In-class practice test No. 1 and discussion of answers. (Not marked.) Readings: Re-read Petty et al. & Amato papers for next tutorial

learning_activities.topic:
Design-Related Confounds and Procedural Confounds

I) More design-related confounds: Sequencing, and Testing confounds; Observer Criterion Shift.

II) Procedural Confounds: Operations Confound.

Identifying confounds, prevention and remedies
learning_activities.topic_description: Design-Related Confounds and Procedural Confounds I) More design-related confounds : Sequencing, and Testing confounds; Observer Criterion Shift. II) Procedural Confounds: Operations Confound. Identifying confounds, prevention and remedies

learning_activities.topic:
Confounds in Published Research I

Analyse potential confounds and interpretational issues in published research (Amato and Petty papers).
learning_activities.topic_description: Confounds in Published Research I Analyse potential confounds and interpretational issues in published research (Amato and Petty papers).

learning_activities.topic:
In-Class Test No 1

Complete the first in-class test. This test will require short answer questions to two case studies. The test will be very similar to the practice test (just on different case studies).
learning_activities.topic_description: In-Class Test No 1 Complete the first in-class test. This test will require short answer questions to two case studies. The test will be very similar to the practice test (just on different case studies).

learning_activities.topic:
Mid-semester Break

No tutes this week!
Read the paper for the practice test 2 and complete practice test 2 for next week.
learning_activities.topic_description: Mid-semester Break No tutes this week! Read the paper for the practice test 2 and complete practice test 2 for next week.

learning_activities.topic:
Mid-semester break

NO LECTURE!
learning_activities.topic_description: Mid-semester break NO LECTURE!

learning_activities.topic:
Design-related and procedural confounds

Discussion of correct answers to the practice test. This will not be marked.

Readings: Read Liebert & Baron for next week
learning_activities.topic_description: Design-related and procedural confounds Discussion of correct answers to the practice test. This will not be marked. Readings: Read Liebert & Baron for next week

learning_activities.topic:
Procedural Confounds

Confounds related to specific procedures: Materials and Operations confounds; Observer, Experimenter, and Participant Expectancy effects as confounds.
learning_activities.topic_description: Procedural Confounds Confounds related to specific procedures: Materials and Operations confounds; Observer, Experimenter, and Participant Expectancy effects as confounds.

learning_activities.topic:
Confounds in Published Research II

Analyse potential confounds and interpretational issues in published research (Liebert & Baron); find rival hypotheses in excerpts of published research.

Readings: Read Brandimonte for the next tutorials.
learning_activities.topic_description: Confounds in Published Research II Analyse potential confounds and interpretational issues in published research (Liebert & Baron); find rival hypotheses in excerpts of published research. Readings: Read Brandimonte for the next tutorials.

learning_activities.topic:
External Validity

Five dimensions of external validity (settings, tasks, materials, participants, time period); detecting external validity problems; ensuring and improving external validity.
learning_activities.topic_description: External Validity Five dimensions of external validity (settings, tasks, materials, participants, time period); detecting external validity problems; ensuring and improving external validity.

learning_activities.topic:
Control Techniques and Published Research

Explore experimental designs and control techniques in published research (Brandimonte and Liebert & Baron)
learning_activities.topic_description: Control Techniques and Published Research Explore experimental designs and control techniques in published research (Brandimonte and Liebert & Baron)

learning_activities.topic:
In-Class Test No. 2

Complete the in-class test 2. This test will contain similar short-answer question as the practice test 2, but on a different paper.
learning_activities.topic_description: In-Class Test No. 2 Complete the in-class test 2. This test will contain similar short-answer question as the practice test 2, but on a different paper.

learning_activities.topic:
Control Techniques and Published Research II

Explore experimental designs and control techniques in published research (Silvera).
learning_activities.topic_description: Control Techniques and Published Research II Explore experimental designs and control techniques in published research (Silvera).

learning_activities.topic:
Designing state-of-the-art experiments

Design experiments to test a research question; use creative and analytical skills to identify and rectify potential problems
learning_activities.topic_description: Designing state-of-the-art experiments Design experiments to test a research question; use creative and analytical skills to identify and rectify potential problems
